claim.body:
roof for harvesting and recycling rain water, comprising:
a water filtration system disposed to mimic a natural wetland ecosystem, said water filtration system lined with at least one water-impervious layer of material disposed on a top surface of a roof of a building, thereby defining a wetland filtration area; and
a water containment area located directly beneath said water filtration system and disposed within a footprint of the building to collect water from the water filtration system to be made available for use;
a means for pumping water from said water containment area up to and into said wetland filtration area; and
a water re-entry pipe for moving water from said wetland filtration area to said water containment area.

claim-text.content: 1. A self sustaining roof for harvesting and recycling rain water, comprising:

a water filtration system disposed to mimic a natural wetland ecosystem, said water filtration system lined with at least one water-impervious layer of material disposed on a top surface of a roof of a building, thereby defining a wetland filtration area; and

a water containment area located directly beneath said water filtration system and disposed within a footprint of the building to collect water from the water filtration system to be made available for use;
a means for pumping water from said water containment area up to and into said wetland filtration area; and
a water re-entry pipe for moving water from said wetland filtration area to said water containment area.

claim.body: at least one water-impermeable layer placed beneath said water containment area.

content: , further comprising at least one water-impermeable layer placed beneath said water containment area.

claim.body: the building comprises at least one wall defining a perimeter of said footprint, and further wherein said water-impermeable layer beneath said water containment area extends at least waist high up the perimeter-defining wall of the building.

content: , wherein the building comprises at least one wall defining a perimeter of said footprint, and further wherein said water-impermeable layer beneath said water containment area extends at least waist high up the perimeter-defining wall of the building.

claim.body: at least one water-pervious layer placed between said wetland filtration area and said water containment area.

content: , further comprising at least one water-pervious layer placed between said wetland filtration area and said water containment area.

claim-text.content: 5. A vegetated roof system for harvesting and recycling rain water, comprising:

a layer comprising a first area comprising vegetation and a second area comprising a wetland filtration system, said layer disposed on a top surface of a roof of a building to harvest at least a portion of rain water that impinges on said layer;
said wetland filtration system arranged to filter excess rain water not used by said vegetation;
a water containment area disposed to collect water from the layer, said collected water to be made available for use;

a water-pervious fabric disposed between said vegetation area and said water containment area such that excess water leaches from the vegetation area into said water containment area through said water-pervious fabric;
a means for pumping water from said water containment area up to and into said wetland filtration system area; and
a means for moving water from said wetland filtration system area to said water containment area;
wherein said wetland filtration system area is separated from other regions of said vegetated roof system by a water-impervious layer of material.

claim.body: a biological filter media located between said layer of vegetation and said water-pervious fabric.

content: , further comprising a biological filter media located between said layer of vegetation and said water-pervious fabric.

claim.body: wetland filtration system comprises bio-balls.

content: , wherein said wetland filtration system comprises bio-balls.

claim.body: wetland filtration system further comprises gravel.

content: , wherein said wetland filtration system further comprises gravel.

claim.body: water containment area comprises a plurality of rain tanks.

content: , wherein said water containment area comprises a plurality of rain tanks.

claim.body: water containment area further comprises a gray water storage tank.

content: , wherein said water containment area further comprises a gray water storage tank.

claim.body: gray water storage tank is located on a roof of a building, or one story below.

content: , wherein said gray water storage tank is located on a roof of a building, or one story below.

claim.body: a second pump located in the wetlands filtration system area to pump water to the vegetation area.

content: , further comprising a second pump located in the wetlands filtration system area to pump water to the vegetation area.

claim.body: an overflow system.
overflow system connects with local storm water management or to a separate harvesting basin on the ground.

content: , wherein said overflow system connects with local storm water management or to a separate harvesting basin on the ground.

claim.body: harvesting basin is arranged to contain water that could be used at ground level.

content: , wherein said harvesting basin is arranged to contain water that could be used at ground level.

claim.body: harvesting basin is arranged to be a deep ground infiltrating drain so that the water can re-enter and help recharge an aquifer.

content: , wherein said harvesting basin is arranged to be a deep ground infiltrating drain so that the water can re-enter and help recharge an aquifer.

claim.body: at least one water-impervious layer placed below said water containment area.

content: , further comprising at least one water-impervious layer placed below said water containment area.

claim.body: at least one water-impervious layer comprises at least one of polypropylene and EPDM material.

content: , wherein said at least one water-impervious layer comprises at least one of polypropylene and EPDM material.

claim.body: at least two water-pervious fabrics, and wherein said at least one water-impermeable layer is placed between said at least two water-pervious fabrics.

content: , further comprising at least two water-pervious fabrics, and wherein said at least one water-impermeable layer is placed between said at least two water-pervious fabrics.

claim.body: at least one of said at least two water-pervious fabrics comprises geo-textile fabric.

content: , wherein at least one of said at least two water-pervious fabrics comprises geo-textile fabric.

claim-text.content: 21. A vegetated roof system for harvesting and recycling rain water, comprising:
a layer comprising terrestrial vegetation disposed on a top surface of a roof of a building to harvest at least a portion of rain water that impinges on said layer;
a water containment area disposed to collect water from the vegetation layer, said collected water to be made available for use;
a water-pervious fabric disposed between said vegetation layer and said water containment area;

a water filtration system arranged to filter excess rain water not used by said vegetation, said water filtration system located between said vegetation layer and said water-pervious fabric, whereby excess water leaches from the vegetation layer into said water containment area through said water-pervious fabric; and
a means for pumping water from said water containment area up to and into said water filtration system.

claim.body: an area where there is no layer of terrestrial vegetation located above said water filtration system.

content: , further comprising an area where there is no layer of terrestrial vegetation located above said water filtration system.

claim.body: water filtration system comprises at least one of gravel and bio-balls.

content: , wherein said water filtration system comprises at least one of gravel and bio-balls.
